text: This place is good. Food is average. But itâ€™s expensive. Quantity is small though. Itâ€™s an outdoor restaurant. But they had a shade.

fried rice = very good
yakitori = good
tempura = good
miso soup + ramen soup happened to be much too salty , unfortunately. probably a one-off for our visit only.

Been here couple of times now, and still as good as the first time. Food standard is  always consistent.

My all time favorite is the garlic fried rice - portion is big , surume Ika - the skewer -! The skewers were cooked well and had a distinct smokey aroma perfectly .. Was Definitely deserving of its 5 star rating!

The waitress had a moody face but after a few orders in, her service became better. The food was well cooked and the seafood was quite fresh. Quite a chill place to have a few drinks and some skewers with friends. Very long walk from the nearest LRT station though. Better to drive or cycle there.

This sake bar is a gem in Punggol . They have a loyal customer following and have survived all these years because of the consistent quality of their food and drinks. My favorites are their Garlic Fried Rice , Geso karaage, Yaki soba  and lastly their no 1 â€œKagoshima Buta Teriyaki  . One of our favorite dinner haunts in Punggol .ðŸ˜‹
